title: Paedophile snared by schoolgirl's snap after she quickly took it when he tried to snatch her
text:
Paedophile snared by schoolgirl's snap after she quickly took it when he tried to snatch her The 14-year-old's actions made attacker Roger Seath freeze, which alerted passers-by Share Schoolgirl took this picture of Roger Seath when he tried to snatch her (Photo: Solent News & Photo Agency) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! A quick-thinking schoolgirl took this photo as a ­paedophile tried to snatch her – and got him locked up. 
The 14-year-old girl, who cannot be named for legal reasons, snapped Roger Seath on her phone as he cornered her in Southsea, Hampshire. 
It caused her 45-year-old attacker to freeze and a group of people driving past were alerted to what was going on. 
When police arrived Seath, who had threatened to ‘spank’ the girl if she did not go with him admitted his offence. 
Judge Anne Arnold praised the teenager’s actions at Portsmouth Crown Court, where Seath was sentenced on Friday. 
She said: "This was a particularly vulnerable victim in my view, a 14-year-old schoolgirl. 
"She was certainly threatened by you with being spanked if she didn’t go with you. 
“Because she, very fortunately was an intelligent and alert girl with sufficient wherewithal to do exactly what she’d been told to do if approached by somebody such as yourself and that was why she took your photograph, freezing your approach long enough to be assisted.” Read More Paedophiles like appalling Mark Frost must NEVER be given access to children Roger Seath was sentenced to 33 months in jail at Portsmouth Crown Court (Photo: Getty) 
The girl had been told by her mother to take a photo of anyone who approached her or hit out if she was touched following a previous report of another schoolgirl being approached. 
A motorist who was driving past when homeless Seath tried to grab the girl, confronted him as the terrified and tearful teenager was led away. 
Robert Bryan, prosecuting, said the defendant had followed the girl, matching her pace as she walked across the road to get away from him. 
The court heard how after arriving in Portsmouth he was staying in a hotel, following schoolgirls and videoing them on his iPhone. 
Footage played in court showed him walking just two feet away from two other teenage girls and police found he had more than 300 images of girls from a social media network. Read More Paedophile being spared jail so he could start a family 'utterly perverse and repellent sentence' 
Chat logs showed he had messaged, called and tried to video call 10 young teenagers, including bombarding one girl he found online. 
Seath made 4,246 searches on his phone in seven days - 600 a day - with the majority related to teenage girls. 
David Reid, defending, said his client had little memory of the incident or the time leading up to it. 
He added: “Roger Seath does recognise this young girl would have been very scared about what he did and the public in general would be concerned about his behaviour.’ 
Judge Arnold said: "You do appear to be a danger to children." 
Seath admitted attempted abduction with intent to commit a sexual offence and having a bladed article - a butter knife - in a public place. 
He was sentenced to 33 months imprisonment and must sign the sex offenders’ register for 10 years, as well as a lifetime order which restricts his access to children. 
He must also pay a £170 victim surcharge. Like us on Facebook
